stadium.name: The Unruly Yard
stadium.description: A field in the center of the city's most rebellious district. The stadium is covered in graffiti, the crowd is hostile, and riots are a common post-game (and mid-game) event.

stats.pregame_ritual: Drinking a shot of hot gravy from a dented tin cup.
Arranging their gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral.
Testing the heft of their weapon with a series of slow, deliberate swings.
Kissing the Trollball on its stitched 'nose'.
Reviewing hand signals for secret plays.
Refusing to step on any lines on the field before the whistle blows.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Reciting a short, epic poem about a past victory.
Arranging their gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral.
Refusing to step on any lines on the field before the whistle blows.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.

Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.

stadium.name: The Aegis Field
stadium.description: A pristine field within the main temple compound, used as the central training ground for the Shield. The pitch is bordered by the library and monastery, and is said to be protected by the twin lights, Dawn's Hope and Silver Twilight.

stats.pregame_ritual: Tying their bootlaces together and hopping to the starting line.
Re-taping their shield's handle with fresh leather.
Whispering a secret fear to the Trollball before the game.
Drinking a full waterskin of lukewarm water.
Drawing a detailed, anatomically incorrect diagram of a troll's head.
Passing a 'team luckstone' from player to player without speaking.
Chewing a specific, bitter root said to improve night vision.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Kissing their biceps and whispering words of encouragement to them.
Trying to teach a stray dog a complicated and useless new trick.
Challenging a spectator to a game of tic-tac-toe in the dirt.
Re-taping their shield's handle with fresh leather.
Drinking a full waterskin of lukewarm water.

preGame:
Step right up and lean in close, sports fans! This is Nok the Corrupter, the demon you love to fear, coming to you live and loud from the graffiti-splattered, bone-crunching glory of The Unruly Yard! üèüÔ∏è We are at the fever pitch, the absolute boiling point of Tuesday Night Trollball! It‚Äôs Game Three of the Winners' Bracket playoffs! The Haven Lights and the New Monteforte Chaos Creatures have traded blows like a pair of drunken giants, and now it all comes down to this rubber match! The winner stays in the sunlight of the Winners' Bracket, and the loser? Well, they‚Äôll be taking the long, shameful descent into the Losers' Bracket. Gee whiz, I haven't been this excited since Artorias and Morgwae broke me out of that dreary Demon Prison! ‚õìÔ∏è

The atmosphere here in New Monteforte is practically vibrating with hostility! The 'Rowdy Crowd' is out in force, and the 'Unstable Scaffolding' is creaking under the weight of fans who haven't seen a bath or a peaceful day in years! Looking down at the pitch, the Chaos Creatures are going through their bizarre motions. Alben Diantha is currently plunging his hands into a bucket of ice-cold well water‚Äîtalk about a chilly reception! üßä Meanwhile, Wolbrom Ariella is belting out a sea shanty so horrendously out of tune that I think the Trollball itself is trying to sprout ears just to cover them! It‚Äôs pure, unadulterated passion, folks!

And what about those Haven Lights? They‚Äôve brought their 'virtue' and their 'Hallowed Ground' nonsense into the lion‚Äôs den! Look at Coward Tarton over there, kissing her biceps and whispering sweet nothings to her own muscles. üíã It‚Äôs a bit much, isn't it? And Zwart Bunns is leaning over the Trollball, whispering his secret fears. I hope his biggest fear is a Warhammer to the teeth, because Wieren Ivar looks like he‚Äôs ready to deliver! The tension is thick enough to cut with a Rondel dagger, and the open bar is already flowing! If you aren't drinking, you aren't watching it right! Let‚Äôs get to the carnage! üç∫üí•
postGame:
Jumpin' Jehosaphat, what a display of gridiron gore! Nok the Corrupter here, and my horns are still buzzing from that defensive masterclass! It was a low-scoring affair on the board but a high-scoring one for the local undertakers! üíÄ The Haven Lights have managed to clinch the series with a 2 to 1 victory, proving that sometimes being a buzzkill actually pays off. I wanted to see the Chaos Creatures pull it off for the home crowd, but the Lights just wouldn't let the fire of rebellion stay lit! üïØÔ∏è‚ùå

The game kicked off with Marlane Lounge snagging the Trollball right in the center field. The Chaos Creatures didn't wait to play nice, though! Wolbrom Ariella immediately went for the throat, tackling Zwart Bunns so hard it sent him straight to the infirmary! üöë That‚Äôs the Monteforte spirit! Wieren Ivar tried to make a break for it, but the Chaos defense was stickier than a warlock‚Äôs debt. It was a scramble for the ages, with bodies hitting the dirt faster than Sir Tanos hits a tavern! üçª

The violence didn't stop there, no sir! Marlane Lounge, clearly seeking some holy retribution, absolutely flattened Fogel Raynold! The sound of that impact was music to my ears, like a symphony of cracking ribs! üé∂ But then, the tables turned when Placido Kora retaliated by injuring Lounge right back! It was a literal 'eye for an eye' out there, and I suspect even Geth the Gravelord was taking notes on the body count! ü¶¥

Then came the play that changed the game. Riffle Heyde, after a frantic scramble, secured the ball deep in Chaos territory. With the defense closing in, Zwart Bunns‚Äîwho had clearly recovered from his earlier nap‚Äîlet fly with a spectacular shot from the 2-point zone! üéØ SWISH! Two points for the Lights! The Unruly Yard went silent for a microsecond before the booing reached a level that probably rattled the windows in the Temple of Light! ‚õ™

Just before we could catch our breath for halftime, Tybi Reo decided she hadn't done enough damage and sent Wolbrom Ariella to the sidelines with a nasty injury. The 'heroes' of Haven sure talk a big game about light and hope, but they've got no problem breaking a few legs when the playoffs are on the line! ü¶µ I love the hypocrisy; it‚Äôs almost demonic in its beauty! üòà

Halftime saw everyone patched up and sent back out, likely fueled by some of that hot gravy Lian Denton loves so much. The second half started with a vengeance! Shiroma Salim wasted no time in knocking Wolbrom Ariella right back out of the game! ü§ï It was like a revolving door for the poor guy. If I were him, I‚Äôd stick to the sea shanties and stay off the pitch for a while! üé§

But wait! The Chaos Creatures weren't dead yet! Gabriele Klehm and Raouf Dragone pushed the ball forward with the kind of desperation you only see in the Winners' Bracket. Finally, Wolbrom Ariella‚Äîback on his feet again‚Äîsprinted into the end zone and slammed the ball home for a dunk! üèÄ The crowd erupted, the scaffolding swayed, and for a moment, it looked like New Monteforte might just steal the series! 1-2! The comeback was on!

Alas, the Haven Lights decided to play 'keep-away' with the Chaos Creatures' health bars. Riffle Heyde took out Fogel Raynold (again!), Berkin Waters leveled Tucker Hett, and Wieren Ivar sent Gabriele Klehm to see the healer. üè• It was a systematic dismantling of the Monteforte roster. Every time the Creatures tried to get a pass going, a mace or a billhook was there to interrupt the conversation! üî®

By the final whistle, the 'Unruly Yard' looked more like a hospital ward. Zwart Bunns even managed to injure Fogel Raynold one more time just for good measure! I think Fogel is going to be seeing twin lights for a week! üòµ The drunkenness in the stands was matched only by the exhaustion on the field. I saw a street performer trying to juggle broken helmets near the end zone, and frankly, he was the only one not bleeding! ü§°

So, the Haven Lights take the game 2 to 1 and win the series 2 games to 1! üèÜ They advance through the Winners' Bracket, while the New Monteforte Chaos Creatures are headed down to the Losers' Bracket to fight for their lives. It‚Äôs a bitter pill to swallow for the home fans, who are currently expressing their disappointment by throwing rocks at the library windows. ü™®üìö

That wraps up a truly brutal week of Trollball! The 'heroes' move on, the rebels fall back, and I‚Äôm going to go see if Imra has any of that 'Dust' left to take the edge off this Haven victory. üçπ This is Nok the Corrupter, reminding you that in Trollball, the only thing that stays dead is your dignity! Goodnight, Osterra, and keep swinging those hammers! üéôÔ∏èüòà
